intro: Lastrea padangensis, commonly known as the Padang starfish plant, is a unique succulent native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, which is characterized by its fleshy leaves and adaptive features for arid environments. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, showcasing a compact, star-shaped appearance with small, waxy leaves. Its flowering period occurs during the warmer months, producing clusters of small, star-like flowers in shades of yellow and white. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is often cultivated in specialized horticultural settings.
